documentation.content:
## Main Salesforce Packaging API Classes Overview

```APIDOC
Package1Version: Work with 1st generation package versions.
Package: Work with 2nd generation packages.
PackageVersion: Work with 2nd generation package versions.
SubscriberPackageVersion: Work with 2nd generation subscriber package versions.
```

## APIDOC: Create Result ID Cannot Be Empty

```APIDOC
createResultIdCannotBeEmpty:
  Message: The package version create result ID must be defined when checking for completion.
```

## Salesforce Packaging Error: deploydirCannotBeUndefined

```APIDOC
Error Code: deploydirCannotBeUndefined
Description: The deploy directory must be defined. Supplied options: %s
```

## signupDuplicateSettingsSpecified

```APIDOC
You cannot use 'settings' and 'orgPreferences' in your scratch definition file, please specify one or the other.
```

## errorReadingDefintionFile

```APIDOC
There was an error while reading or parsing the provided scratch definition file: %s
```

## Quick Start Development Workflow

```Shell
cd packaging
git checkout main
git pull
yarn install
yarn clean-all
yarn build
git checkout -b <branch_name>
yarn test
yarn test:nuts
git status
git add .
git commit
git push -u origin <branch_name>
```

## APIDOC: Error Invalid ID No Matching Version

```APIDOC
errorInvalidIdNoMatchingVersionId:
  Message: The %s %s is invalid, as a corresponding %s was not found
```

## Subscriber Package Version Publishing Progress

```APIDOC
Waiting for the Subscriber Package Version ID to be published to the target org.%s
```

## Initial Project Setup Commands

```Shell
git clone git@github.com:forcedotcom/packaging.git
npm install --global yarn
```

## APIDOC: Max Package2Version Records Reached

```APIDOC
maxPackage2VersionRecords:
  Message: The maximum result size (2000) was reached when querying the Package2Version SObject. This means there could be more records that were not returned by the query. If all records are required you may have to break the query into multiple requests filtered by date, then aggregate the results.
```
